title.narrative: Maternal and Child Nutrition Stunting Reduction Program

description.narrative: The program aims to reach out to children and pregnant and lactating women that are affected with stunting, SAM, Vitamin deficiencies, etc. in an effort to improve nutrition in Sindh Provinces. A regular process and output monitoring will be carried out throughout the project life as per performance indicator guide, all the project interventions will be monitored and verified at field level. AAH will establish 22 static sites in 15 RHCs, 5 THQs, and 2 DHQs in both districts. 1400 LHWs/LHSs and 236 Couple Health Worker (CHW) will cover up geographical areas (UCs in both districts) to address nutritional needs. This includes 42 UCs in Ghotki and 76 UCs in Khairpur Districts in Sindh. Treatment will follow the revised 2014 National Guidelines for Acute Malnutrition.ACF will train a total of 118 health care providers (HCPs) on standard protocols on micronutrients supplementation in two districts.2 to 5 years children will be dewormed every 6 months as per standard protocol by community outreach worker, Nutrition assistant and IYCF counselors in two districts.
